snippet.textDisplay:
Our planet & the life that inhabits it seems quite efficient at evening the scales when they get tipped to far in any direction.
   If the world truly is as old as "they" say it is and humans have been around for as long as "they" say we have, then it doesn't take a whole lot of reasoning to see the rapid population increase is not something new only seen within the last 80 - 100 years. There will be and always has been major events that wipe out large populations. If it isn't nature, it is humans themselves and if it isn't humans it's misguided nutty humans messing with nature.  From the moment of conception we are dying. So many people get wrapped up in the "when" and "how" or obsess over preventing the inevitable, they forget to live life.
